sections.purpose: To sterilize media, instruments, and waste using vertical steam autoclaving.
sections.scope: Applicable to routine sterilization in Microbiology.
procedure: Check water level in the autoclave boiler and fill with treated water if required.
Load items into the autoclave basket ensuring space for steam circulation.
Close and lock the lid according to manufacturer instructions.
Set the sterilization temperature, pressure, and time (e.g., 121°C, 15 psi, 15–30 minutes).
Start the cycle and monitor pressure and temperature gauges.
At the end of the cycle, allow pressure to return to zero before opening the lid.
Open the lid cautiously to vent steam and allow items to cool before removal.
Record cycle details and any observations in the logbook.
precautions: Never attempt to open the lid under pressure.
Wear heat-resistant gloves and face protection when unloading.
Ensure regular maintenance and validation with biological indicators.
Check safety valves and gaskets periodically for proper function.
